page.title: 12Pollution In The River
page.content: Many factories are found along the Humber Bank and these all threaten to spoil the environment. Many thousands of pounds are spent on reducing the pollution in the river but many people like{Greenpeace}say that not enough is being done. In 1985 great concern is felt over the production if Titanium Dioxide. The factory is found down river at Grimsby but with tides in the Humber any pollution will be carried up and down the river. The Goverment says that Tioxide is useful but it{ {should be controlled}and pollution should be limited. The company claim that{the effect of pollution is {over-exagerated.}Much has already been done to reduce the amount of effluent put into the river. Careful recording of all products put into the river takes place. Local people (especially fishermen) do not agree.
